The trial of the athlete Oscar Pistorius was dedicated to discovering if he had intended to shoot reeva steenkamp through the bathroom wall, or if as Pistorius claimed he had in fact believed he was shooting at an armed Intruder behind the bathroom door key Witnesses living in neighboring compound said they had heard voices shouting and arguing before hearing gunfire Pistorius testified that after he realized that it was steenkamp that he had shot by accident he

In panic and grab the cricket bat to smash through the locked door during the cross-examination of the ear witnesses to the crime a replica of this bathroom door was brought into the courtroom and the forensic audio expert and with a cricket bat began to beat it many times. This clamor was made to demonstrate that a cricket bat striking a wooden door could produce a deafening sound as intense as the blast of a gunshot the cricket bat blast punctuated a line of questioning that sought to place a seed of doubt in the ears of the witnesses had they heard steenkamp shouts followed by gunfire or Pistorius scream followed by the sound of a cricket bat striking her door this demonstration turned the courtroom into a makeshift sound effects studio and the expert witness into a Foley artist though. His performance was billed as a forensic reenactment what it actually achieve was a demonstration of the deceitful and illusory nature of sound were clearly distinct and conventionally, unassociated objects, like guns and cricket bats.

The torture room is not just the setting in which torture occurs. It is itself literally converted into another weapon all aspects of the basic structure walls ceiling Windows Doors undergo this conversion just as all aspects of the concrete structure. I never to be assimilated into the process of torture. So to the contents of the room its Furnishings are converted into weapons people describe being beaten with family sighs soft drink bottles or having a hand crushed with a chair having their heads repeatedly banged on the edges of a refrigerator door or against the edges of a filing cabinet the room both in its structure and its content is converted into a weapon then D converted undone made to demonstrate that everything is a weapon the objects themselves and with them.

The fact of civilization are annihilated there is no wall. No windows. No doors. No bathtub. No refrigerator. No chair. No bed Elaine Scarry. Fiberglass. Sledgehammer flip-flops. Froggy Rose galvanized Dustbin goalkeeper gloves Granite Stone tiles green coconut. The sound effects in Wildlife documentaries are extremely over the top the loud slurp of a polar bear licking. Its paws always removed me from the Arctic Circle and brought me to imagine some human in a dim Echoes basement recording studio surrounded by peculiar objects, which they endlessly flick flail brush strike and squeeze into microphones paradoxically. I really ever wonder about the labor of the sound effects artists in works of pure fiction like Game of Thrones. I only learned quite lately that in this show. They use green coconuts to create the sound of all their decapitations as many of us have never heard a real decapitation. I think that green coconut sound more like human heads.

Us then human heads actually do meaning that if we were to hear a human head instead of a green coconut. We may not be so convinced. Whereas we know that the scaly skin of an iguana squirming up a rock would not sound like it was wearing a pair of leather sweatpants. There was however one scene in Game of Thrones in which the sound effects did shatter my suspension of disbelief was not the rattling growl of a dragon all the stumps of a giant ice zombie which Brought me hurtling Back Down to Earth, but rather the very simple gesture of one character closing a door as I heard this door shut. I had an acoustic flashback. I had heard that exact sound summer before it was in fact the same stock door closing track. How in Russia guards were trained to slam the door in as jarring away as possible or to close it in equally unnerving silence the doors inside Maya prison had a similar effect on its survivors D AB explained to me that the sound is impossible to erase from one's memory.

However, the sound of the doors is not only used to spread fear Salam and others used it like a sonar echolocation device that helped him and his fellow detainees locate the position of the guards salams comprehensive account of the sound of cell doors allowed us to approximate how many cells were in use in his wing and was one of many details that made it possible for amnesty to estimate how many prisoners will be incarcerated at that time Salam: every cell door and There Were Ten cells in our wing had unique sound. What we would do is memorize those sounds to know which cell door was being opened. I memorized them in sequence first. I to devoted much of my time to trying to hear the absence of sound I was looking for different ways to measure the state of enforced silence because I believe that the silence itself constituted a human rights violation not as it functions in isolation cells in the US as an act of torture based on sensory deprivation, but one more closely related to the stress position defined as forcing the human body to adopt and remain for great period of time in static squat positions or equivalent in which the whole body's weight is borne by just one or two muscles likewise. The order of complete silence is use its I admire to restrict prisoners physical movements and suppress that respiratory functions forcing them to remain still not to cough or clear their throats not to stretch or exercise their muscles for fear of making any sound at all attempting to explain to me the signs that said Nyah Jamal said that one of the loudest sounds was the killing of Lights.

Amplitude he said was equivalent to that of crushing a sesame seed between your thumb and forefinger silver foil helium balloon slingshot sneakers, the guards of side naya-a dressed in military uniforms except that they do not wear the standard-issue army boots, but rather sneakers Witnesses often remarked that the sound of the God's footsteps really preceded them army boots were deemed too loud for the carefully cultivated and brutally enforced silence for which the prison is now Infamous across Syria. I was told that inside Nyah whenever a prisoner came into contact with the gods, they would have to adopt a specific position Neely on the ground facing the wall and covering their eyes of their hands at the first sign of the guards approach detainees would have to adopt this position quickly or face the infliction of potentially fatal violence. The guards would often try to catch them out of this position by creeping up on them this meant that in order to avoid being beaten one had to be constantly alert to the smallest.

Stuff sounds to apprehend the sound of someone trying to sneak up wearing sneakers on a concrete floor is not so much about listening to the tap of the shoes impact with the ground. But rather to the sound of the insole sliding forward as pressure is exerted onto it squeaking slightly as it rubs on the layer beneath measuring the amplitude and Sonic constitution of such squeaks allows some insight into the state of hyper alertness in which inhabitants were forced to live at all times this reframes our understanding of Sonic torture to include not only the playing of excruciatingly loud music but also forcing people to listen out for the most minut amplitudes steel wool stilettos sunflower seeds tissue box Tomatoes Toyota Land Cruiser car horn train whistle in confirming the location of a CIA black site in central book arrest, the ear witness testimony of a former detainee was vital due to the fact that he had heard the constant Omni directional sound of rail.

What kind of instruments were being used during the interviews the witnesses and I would try to describe and think of ways to recreate these sounds with the hope of making a comprehensive account of all the different weapons being used there Jamal compared one weapon sound to the strike of an iron bar landing on top of a wooden table and another made a sound like a leather belt against the plaster wall Sam as descriptions involves striking a specifically Woolen not firm mattress while also explaining that when they hit the bottom of detainees feet it made a sound like hitting a plastic bag filled with cotton clothing at times their instructions required the combination of two. Usually unassociated objects. Like Wendy AB said I should hit a leather handbag with a willow stick other descriptions were drawn from more familiar memories, like when an ass described a specific weapon as making the same sound.

Because when people beat the dust out of their rugs out on their balconies in Damascus using wicker carpet beaters these objects with the materials that they thought were best suited to mimic the sounds of the real weapons with the implicit understanding that if we had the actual weapons themselves, we could get a more precise reproduction. However, when Jamal and Salam came to describe the sound of the water supply pipe hitting someone inside Maya, they explained that getting the exact same weapon and recreating It Strike would be inadequate to achieve the sound they remembered it making doesn't sound like something is hitting a body Journal explains. It sounds like someone is demolishing a wall Salam corroborates. Don't just get a plastic pipe and hit someone you have to get a sledge hammer and smash it against the wall. Then you will get the exact sound we heard when they use that weapon yard chain Yellow Pages in the process of accumulating my own sound effects Library specific to the investigation of a witness testimony. I've come across many descriptions in witchy Witnesses explain the

Sounds they heard in the negative didn't sound like a punch or not at all, like gunshots or it doesn't sound like something is hitting a body these Witnesses know what it is. They heard they do not say I did not hear a punch, but at the punch they heard didn't sound like a punch meaning the sound we expected to make which is often conditioned by the sounds they've heard on TV or at the cinema currently one of the most popular punch sound effect for the screen is created by dropping a phone book to the ground for many of us whose primary experience of violence is Cinematic this particular punch sound has become what we imagine and expect a real punch to sound like yet witnesses to real assaults suggest that punches son quite different doesn't sound like a punch but a lighter being thrown to the ground and popping said a witness in an Oregon court house while another witness to this same punch that it sounded like the noise of a cinderblock falling on concrete and New Zealand witness said of a blow he overheard that it sounded like an egg cracking and a

Let's in Hastings described hearing an assault like a watermelon smashing. These are but a few examples I have encountered where Witnesses first negate the sound we expect to hear only to then describe the real sound in terms of alternate imaginary sound effects of their own devising our experience and memories of acoustic violence is completely convolved with the production of sound effects to the extent that watermelons egg cinder blocks leather handbags a rack of Trades and a cigarette lighter and not simply objects that describe an event. They are themselves devices by which memories are encoded stored recalled and retrieved.
